We can just keep is_regression around and do ifs based on that.

I think the idea is for every protobuf object, we have a operator class equivalent for it. body_text:
We can just keep is_regression around and do ifs based on that.
…
On Thu, Aug 23, 2018 at 3:03 PM Peng Yu ***@***.***> wrote:
 ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
 ------------------------------

 In tensorflow/core/kernels/tensor_forest/leaf_model.h
 <#21803 (comment)>
 :

 > +#include "tensorflow/core/framework/tensor.h"
 +#include "tensorflow/core/framework/tensor_types.h"
 +#include "tensorflow/core/kernels/tensor_forest/tensor_forest.pb.h"
 +
 +namespace tensorflow {
 +
 +using tensorforest::Leaf;
 +using tensorforest::LeafStat;
 +
 +typedef TTypes<const float, 2>::ConstTensor DenseTensorType;
 +
 +namespace {
 +enum LeafModelType { CLASSIFICATION = 0, REGRESSION = 1 };
 +}
 +
 +class LeafModelOperator {

 there is a difference for leafs when ExportModel and UpdateModel between
 classification
 https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/21579/files#diff-c000cbb3c7359ba2e87d29b7b3e4c399R63
 and regression
 https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/21579/files#diff-c000cbb3c7359ba2e87d29b7b3e4c399R70
 .

 I think the idea is for every protobuf object, we have a operator class
 equivalent for it.

 But still, what would you suggest if we remove this abstraction?

 —
 You are receiving this because your review was requested.

body:
We can just keep is_regression around and do ifs based on that.
